posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
...is what I'm currently in, so I come to the Guild for some guidance.

I confess, this started out as a name that simply came to me while I was writing something else. And that name was Tulip Brickhead. And he was a Dwarf. So I had a mull as to what sort of character he might be, and figured him a gentle but stubborn soul. Thus, an ideal party tank. Not interested in inflicting great swathes of damage and mayhem, but absolutely determined to protect his friends from harm. He has no arcane or divine assistance, just the strength of his heart (after all, this is me asking, after all 😇).

So I went into a Dex-based Dwarven Defender with EDRIII. The best I came up with was a Fighter 16/ DwD 19/ Harper Scout 5. He ended up with 21/- DR, 658 hit points, and an AC of 29 naked or in full plate, 32 with tower shield (he's not an idiot: he's not looking to get hit). He has an AB of 43 with his finessed hatchet (40 ranged), and all his saves are over 20 (but under 30). He also has 10 uses of Defensive Stance a day.

All of which seemed alright. Not brilliant, but alright. And then I wondered...How about an EDRIII DwD with Epic Dodge? And that's where my quandary began.

The best I've managed to date is a Fighter 8/ Rogue 14/ DwD 18. On the plus side, it gains 51 skill points and ED. On the minus side it loses 3 AB, 2 AC (robes) or 1 (full plate), and 1 Defensive Stance. It also means either ED or EDRIII come very late in the build.

Can you offer any assistance, please? Don't get me wrong, I'm not asking for a full build from you good people, just some thoughts on how I might improve things. Or, indeed, whether the whole EDRIII and ED idea is a dumb one (in a purely mundane build, ofc).

Thanks in advance!

Cheers

EDIT: Oh, btw, this doesn't mean I've forgotten about Viconia, but this one just became something of a brain-itch.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: If you use Shadowdancer instead of Rogue to qualify for ED, you only need 10 levels, or 11 for a late Tumble dump.  It would not require you to use a stealthy play style, unless you feel compelled to roleplay your classes.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
I think you could start with the requirements for Epic Dodge:
- Shadowdancer 10
- Rogue 13
- Monk 9 SD 5
- Rogue 10 SD 5
- Monk 9 Rogue 10

Consider adding a level of a tumble class if you want to get Epic Dodge asap, so there can be a tumble dump late.

Then add DD (and whatever third class you wish, if there isn't one)

A fighter 8 SD 10 DD 22 might be interesting? It will have evasion, and wont be totally ineffective in terms of damage with epic weapon specialization without being overpowering with too much sneak attack.
Same with Ranger SD 10 DD, or even paladin 

Hope that helps

Edit: noted Sathrovar's links with many thanks!

I like syrath1001's Movable Wall, except change the rapier to a handaxe as per your preference, and other preferences. 
It combines Epic Damage Reduction 3 (total DR 24/-), Epic Dodge, Evasion, HiPS, AB 41, Epic Weapon Specialization for +6 damage, and Str 14 for +2-8 damage.
Epic Weapon Specialization is pretty quick at level 21, that is an excellent feature of the build. 
EDR I-III is pretty late at levels 31-35. I would move this earlier, in fact as soon as possible.
Epic Dodge is pretty late, at level 39 but with dwarven defender, great HP, evasion and HiPS this feels more like the "icing on the cake" or the "cherry on top". 
I think this would turn out to be a very nice party tank in a challenging environment.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Interesting character concept, Stag!
The name gives me completely different associations though.
Tulip Brickhead is a female gnome.
She is of the renown Brickhead clan, known for their quality stoneskin spells.
She is a jester. Her parents believed that they were gong to have a boy and wanted to call him Turnip. But she fooled them, being a girl and everything. So Turnip was hastily changed to Tulip.

As for alignment she is chaotic good, a free spirit, not tied down by tradition. But she knows the family secret and can do stoneskin quite well.
That brings us to the question of class.  Maybe my mind is playing tricks on me, or perhaps she is, but I see her as a rogue. She has a bit of wizard from her family background. She may well be a jester, but not in the sense of being an artist, but even so, she is not without some charm.
So here we almost have a MAD build with dexterity, intelligence and charisma. Lucky she gets some constitution for free.
ED should be within reach, but she will never be a DC caster and probably never reaches any degree of indispellability.

So there is my go at Tulip. Not at all what you had in mind, alas.


Now as to your project. Simple is work, I couldn't agree more.
Sometimes that work is just throwing out the things on your whish list that you really don't need.
Unless you find a synergy, most things you add to a build come at a cost.
EDR III and ED is possible in a dwd build with a given class combo. But you are getting close to a MAD build, even if you say he is a dexer to begin with. MAD builds are much more easy with RDD, but then we talk strength builds. With dex builds you have the option to take a class that offers great dex as an epic bonus feat to boost dexterity. But none of those classes help qualify for ED other than to have tumble as a class skill.
Sorry, but life is a b****sometimes.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Many thanks, one and all!

I suspect that there is no scintillating answer to my quandary - plenty of adequate ones, but nothing that shines out as worthy of inclusion within the annals of our Guild (not wishing to decry the builds @Sarthrovar cites). I guess that's due to having to spread oneself too thin in order to get too much in, thereby diluting the whole (as Mick hints at) - both in terms of the number of levels one has to invest in a class in order to make use of just one feat, and the stat spread.

I think the itch has been scratched for now. It'll hang around as a bit of a niggle for a while, and I may well return to it later. Oh well.

Thanks again, all. 👍

Oh, and I do like your take on the name, Mick! 😅
